Activity: Wake up, review the week's goals: data cleaning, strategy development, and performance evaluation. Mentally outline the initial approach to each task.

Log in to the system. Check emails and prioritize urgent requests. Respond to emails from @PM-1 regarding project updates. Skim research papers on statistical arbitrage for novel ideas or refined techniques.

Begin data cleaning and preprocessing of dataset A (e.g., stock prices). Handle missing values using imputation techniques (k-NN). Address outliers using winsorization, setting the limit to 5% based on the dataset distribution.

Implement the data cleaning and preprocessing pipeline using Python (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn). Write unit tests to validate the correctness of the data transformation functions (e.g., handling of edge cases, numerical stability).
Lunch break. Read 'The Economist' to stay updated on global financial trends.
Continue implementing and testing the data cleaning pipeline for dataset A. Debug any issues identified by the unit tests.

Start exploring Dataset B and its data cleaning requirements. Define the variables and data types for Dataset B. Check with @QRES-1 regarding the data source for Dataset B to confirm data consistency.

Document the data cleaning and preprocessing steps for dataset A, including rationale for choices made (e.g., imputation method, outlier handling). Commit code to the repository with detailed commit messages.
